content: and is repeated 3 times across the width of the scarf place stitch markers every 19 sts as appropriate cut cc purple blue & cc almost black leaving tails to sew in later stitch count 3 + 58+ 3 = 64 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 19 dahlia row 276 - 289 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 289 introducing cc orange 2 as needed the dahlia motif is 13 stitches wide and is repeated 5 times across the width of the scarf place stitch markers every 13 sts as appropriate cut cc orange 2 leaving a tail to sew in later and rejoin mc white stitch count 3 + 65+ 3 = 78 copyright 2024 suzi ashworth for folkestone harbour yarn day 18 terracotta pot row 264 - 275 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 275 introducing cc terracotta 2 as needed the terracotta pot motif is 18 stitches wide and is repeated 4 times across the width of the scarf place stitch markers every 18 sts as appropriate cut cc terracotta 2 leaving a tail to sew in later stitch count 3 + 72+ 3 = 78 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 17 tulip row 252 - 263 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 263 introducing cc yellow 2 & cc green 1 as needed the tulip motif is 18 stitches wide and is repeated 4 times across the width of the scarf place stitch markers every 18 sts as appropriate and refer to colourwork tips if you need a reminder on 3 stranded knitting cut cc yellow 2 & cc green 1 leaving tails to sew in later stitch count 3 + 78+ 3 = 84 copyright 2024 suzi ashworth for folkestone harbour yarn day 16 mushroom row 240 - 251 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 251 introducing cc variegated brown red as needed the mushroom motif is 12 stitches wide and is repeated 6 times across the width of the scarf with the final fungi on the left edge being knitted from the chart place stitch markers every 12 sts as appropriate cut cc variegated brown red leaving a tail to sew in later stitch count 3 + 84+ 3 = 90 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 15 thistle row 226 - 239 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge +
